  684|     67|    fn compute_record_layout(&mut self, members: &[StructMember], is_union: bool) -> Result<TypeLayout, SemanticError> {
  685|     67|        let mut max_align = 1;
  686|     67|        let mut current_size = 0;
  687|     67|        let mut field_layouts = Vec::with_capacity(members.len());
  688|       |        // For C11 6.7.2.1p18 flexible array check:
  689|       |        // "the last element of a structure with more than one named member may have an incomplete array type"
  690|       |        // But incomplete array types are NOT allowed in unions.
  691|       |        // We will check validity as we iterate.
  692|       |        // Note: The count of members might include anonymous struct/union members which are technically members.
  693|       |
  694|     67|        let member_count = members.len();
  695|       |
  696|    113|        for (i, member) in members.iter().enumerate() {
                                         ^67     ^67    ^67
  697|    113|            let member_ty = member.member_type.ty();
  698|       |
  699|       |            // Special handling for flexible array member (FAM)
  700|       |            // Need to check if it is incomplete array
  701|       |            // We can't use is_complete because that recurses. We check TypeKind directly.
  702|    113|            let is_incomplete_or_vla_array = if member_ty.is_inline_array() {
  703|      5|                false // inline array always has len
  704|       |            } else {
  705|    105|                matches!(
  706|    108|                    self.get(member_ty).kind,
  707|       |                    TypeKind::Array {
  708|       |                        size: ArraySizeType::Incomplete | ArraySizeType::Variable(_),
  709|       |                        ..
  710|       |                    }
  711|       |                )
  712|       |            };
  713|       |
  714|    113|            if is_incomplete_or_vla_array {
  715|      3|                if is_union {
  716|       |                    // Incomplete or VLA types not allowed in union
  717|      1|                    return Err(SemanticError::UnsupportedFeature {
  718|      1|                        feature: "incomplete/VLA array in union".to_string(),
  719|      1|                        span: member.span,
  720|      1|                    });
  721|      2|                }
  722|       |
  723|       |                // Must be last member
  724|      2|                if i != member_count - 1 {
  725|      1|                    return Err(SemanticError::FlexibleArrayNotLast { span: member.span });
  726|      1|                }
  727|       |
  728|       |                // Must have at least one other named member.
  729|       |                // Or rather, "structure with more than one named member".
  730|       |                // If this is the only member, it's invalid.
  731|      1|                if member_count < 2 {
  732|      0|                    return Err(SemanticError::FlexibleArrayInEmptyStruct { span: member.span });
  733|      1|                }
  734|       |
  735|       |                // If valid FAM:
  736|       |                // Size of structure is as if FAM was omitted.
  737|       |                // But we must respect its alignment for the struct's alignment.
  738|       |                // We need to get the element type to find alignment.
  739|      1|                let elem_ty = match &self.get(member_ty).kind {
  740|      1|                    TypeKind::Array { element_type, .. } => *element_type,
  741|      0|                    _ => unreachable!(),
  742|       |                };
  743|      1|                let elem_layout = self.ensure_layout(elem_ty)?;
                                                                           ^0
  744|       |
  745|      1|                max_align = max_align.max(elem_layout.alignment);
  746|       |
  747|       |                // FAM has size 0 for layout purposes of the struct size,
  748|       |                // but its offset is where it would start.
  749|       |                // The standard says: "size of the structure is as if the flexible array member were omitted"
  750|       |                // This means current_size stays as is (after padding for alignment of FAM? No, omitted means omitted).
  751|       |                // "except that it may have more trailing padding than the omission would imply"
  752|       |                // Usually this is interpreted as: sizeof(struct) = max(sizeof(struct_without_fam), offsetof(fam)).
  753|       |                // Or simply: layout the FAM, but don't increment current_size by its size (which is unknown/0).
  754|       |                // But we might need to add padding to current_size to reach FAM alignment?
  755|       |                // "as if the flexible array member were omitted" implies we don't even add padding for it?
  756|       |                // BUT "except that it may have more trailing padding".
  757|       |                // Most compilers align the end of the struct to the alignment of the FAM.
  758|       |
  759|       |                // Let's compute offset.
  760|      1|                let offset = (current_size + elem_layout.alignment - 1) & !(elem_layout.alignment - 1);
  761|      1|                field_layouts.push(FieldLayout { offset });
  762|       |
  763|       |                // We do NOT update current_size with FAM size (which is effectively 0 or variable).
  764|       |                // But we might update current_size to offset?
  765|       |                // GCC: sizeof(struct { int x; int y[]; }) == 4.
  766|       |                //      sizeof(struct { char c; int y[]; }) == 4 (aligned to 4).
  767|       |                // So we do align current_size.
  768|      1|                current_size = offset;
  769|       |
  770|      1|                continue;
  771|    110|            }
  772|       |
  773|    110|            let layout = self.ensure_layout(member_ty)?;
                              ^109                                  ^1
  774|    109|            max_align = max_align.max(layout.alignment);
  775|       |
  776|    109|            if is_union {
  777|     11|                current_size = current_size.max(layout.size);
  778|     11|                field_layouts.push(FieldLayout { offset: 0 });
  779|     98|            } else {
  780|     98|                // Align current_size to member's alignment to find its offset
  781|     98|                let offset = (current_size + layout.alignment - 1) & !(layout.alignment - 1);
  782|     98|                field_layouts.push(FieldLayout { offset });
  783|     98|                current_size = offset + layout.size;
  784|     98|            }
  785|       |        }
  786|       |
  787|       |        // Final size is padded to the record's max alignment
  788|     64|        let final_size = (current_size + max_align - 1) & !(max_align - 1);
  789|       |
  790|     64|        Ok(TypeLayout {
  791|     64|            size: final_size,
  792|     64|            alignment: max_align,
  793|     64|            kind: LayoutKind::Record {
  794|     64|                fields: field_layouts,
  795|     64|                is_union,
  796|     64|            },
  797|     64|        })
  798|     67|    }

  198|       |/// Opaque reference to a canonical type.
  199|       |/// Internally index + 1 (NonZeroU32 for niche optimization).
  200|       |#[derive(Copy, Clone, Debug, PartialEq, Eq, Hash, Serialize)]
  201|       |#[repr(transparent)]
  202|       |pub struct TypeRef(NonZeroU32);
  203|       |
  204|       |impl TypeRef {
  205|       |    // Layout:
  206|       |    // bit  0..=17  (18 bit)  BASE INDEX
  207|       |    // bit 18..=20  (3 bit)   TYPE CLASS
  208|       |    // bit 21..=22  (2 bit)   POINTER DEPTH (0..3)
  209|       |    // bit 23..=27  (5 bit)   ARRAY LEN INLINE (0..31)
  210|       |
  211|       |    const BASE_BITS: u32 = 18;
  212|       |    const CLASS_BITS: u32 = 3;
  213|       |    const PTR_BITS: u32 = 2;
  214|       |    const ARR_BITS: u32 = 5;
  215|       |
  216|       |    const BASE_SHIFT: u32 = 0;
  217|       |    const CLASS_SHIFT: u32 = Self::BASE_BITS;
  218|       |    const PTR_SHIFT: u32 = Self::CLASS_SHIFT + Self::CLASS_BITS;
  219|       |    const ARR_SHIFT: u32 = Self::PTR_SHIFT + Self::PTR_BITS;
  220|       |
  221|       |    const BASE_MASK: u32 = (1 << Self::BASE_BITS) - 1;
  222|       |    const CLASS_MASK: u32 = (1 << Self::CLASS_BITS) - 1;
  223|       |    const PTR_MASK: u32 = (1 << Self::PTR_BITS) - 1;
  224|       |    const ARR_MASK: u32 = (1 << Self::ARR_BITS) - 1;
  225|       |
  226|       |    #[inline]
  227|  6.93k|    pub fn new(base_index: u32, class: TypeClass, ptr_depth: u8, arr_len: u32) -> Option<Self> {
  228|  6.93k|        if base_index == 0 || base_index > Self::BASE_MASK {
  229|      0|            return None; // Base index must be non-zero and fit in 18 bits
  230|  6.93k|        }
  231|  6.93k|        if ptr_depth as u32 > Self::PTR_MASK {
  232|      1|            return None;
  233|  6.93k|        }
  234|  6.93k|        if arr_len > Self::ARR_MASK {
  235|      1|            return None;
  236|  6.93k|        }
  237|       |
  238|       |        // Validate combinations
  239|  6.93k|        match class {
  240|       |            TypeClass::Builtin => {
  241|  5.53k|                if ptr_depth != 0 || arr_len != 0 {
                                                   ^5.52k
  242|      1|                    return None;
  243|  5.52k|                }
  244|       |            }
  245|       |            TypeClass::Pointer => {
  246|    524|                if arr_len != 0 {
  247|      1|                    return None;
  248|    523|                }
  249|       |                // Pointer depth 0 means "Registry Pointer" (valid)
  250|       |                // Pointer depth 1..3 means "Inline Pointer" (valid)
  251|       |            }
  252|       |            TypeClass::Array => {
  253|       |                // Array len 0 means "Registry Array" (valid)
  254|       |                // Array len 1..31 means "Inline Array" (valid)
  255|    358|                if ptr_depth != 0 {
  256|      1|                    return None;
  257|    357|                }
  258|       |            }
  259|       |            TypeClass::Function | TypeClass::Record | TypeClass::Enum | TypeClass::Typedef => {
  260|    519|                if ptr_depth != 0 || arr_len != 0 {
  261|      0|                    return None;
  262|    519|                }
  263|       |            }
  264|       |        }
  265|       |
  266|  6.92k|        let mut raw = 0u32;
  267|  6.92k|        raw |= base_index & Self::BASE_MASK;
  268|  6.92k|        raw |= (class as u32) << Self::CLASS_SHIFT;
  269|  6.92k|        raw |= (ptr_depth as u32) << Self::PTR_SHIFT;
  270|  6.92k|        raw |= (arr_len) << Self::ARR_SHIFT;
  271|       |
  272|  6.92k|        NonZeroU32::new(raw).map(TypeRef)
  273|  6.93k|    }
